basics.name: Robert Kovačević
basics.label: Software Developer
basics.summary: I started programming when I was 10 years old, in QBasic on my 386 PC. I haven't stoped since, and have been doing it professionally for the last 7 years. I worked on telco systems in Java, developed mobile apps for iOS and I'm currently most interested in Javascript.

highlights: Worked on a critical project for large clients in the telecommunications industry
Developed an open source implementation of Diameter protocol in Node.js
Developed testing tools in Python
Worked on end-to-end testing using RobotFramework
Improved build automation with Jenkins
One of the first employees in a startup that grow to 20+ people
Designed and developed RESTful backend data collection system
Worked on creating lean development cycle proceedures
Coordinated with developers in Argentina, Russia, USA...
Communicated with partners and clients
Coordinated and implemented EPA Energy Star integration
Worked on backend development in Java SE, Play Framework, Hibernate JPA, JUnit, PostgreSQL
Worked on frontend development in Javascript, AngularJS, Lodash, JQuery
Participated in agile team workflow, using git, Jenkins, SonarSource, with deployments to Heroku and AWS EC2
Developed mobile applications for major brands like Bosch, Bayer, Swiss Post, Mitsubishi and Toyota
Lead development teams in projects for key international clients
Communicated with clients on product design and roadmap
Coached junior team members
Integration with telecom operators in Switzerland and all over the world
Developing mobile payment and service delivery solutions
Development on mission critical micropayment and service delivery platforms
Lead projects, coordinated with upper management, partners and customers
Technology stack based in Java, with several interconnected platforms, some J2EE (Glassfish and JBoss) and some Spring based
Used JSF, JSP, Tomcat, Maven, Ant, JUnit, etc.
Maintained and deployed to UNIX (Debian) platform
